actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported.
Reported by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 101-631.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 390.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 448 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5350 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. It shall be in order to consider the bill in the House. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order. It shall be in order to consider an amendment offered by Mr. Rostenkowski. All points of order against the bill and amendment for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 5(a) of rule XXI are waived.
Rule H. Res. 448 passed House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 448.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5350 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. It shall be in order to consider the bill in the House. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order. It shall be in order to consider an amendment offered by Mr. Rostenkowski. All points of order against the bill and amendment for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 5(a) of rule XXI are waived.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 247 - 172 (Roll no. 313).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-350.

official_title: To provide for a temporary increase in the public debt limit.

summary.text: Increases the public debt limit from the date of enactment of this Act until October 2, 1990, to $3,195,000,000,000.

titles.title: To provide for a temporary increase in the public debt limit.
